intro: Triaristellina triaristella, commonly known as the three-lobed starwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
